column4: hey could anyone help me? i have a samsung n130 netbook running Ubuntu 12.04 and the wireless internet connection switches on and off. i am a new Ubuntu user, any help would be muchly appreciated ^__^
Be careful you're not hitting the power switch for the wireless nic.  Happens all the time.
Are you losing power or getting disconnected?
Do you have an android phone?  if so download wifi analyzer and watch the signal strength on the router.  It might be crapping out on you.  Can also use that app to find less clogged channels.
try seeing if you can find an app that will pick up Wireless APs and show their signal strength.
there doesnt seem to be any problems with the router.
So the signal strength is staying steady right?
the signal strength is nice and steady
Hrmm  have you tried loading a different driver for the wireless?   It shouldn't be dropping the connection if the signal strength is steady.  Let me look something up
awww thankyou, im new to Ubuntu, i really appreciate this ^__^
Disable IPV6 on it and see if that helps.
how do i do that?
Click on the network icon and click configure network
Then go to wireless if memory serves
done it, deleted them, and re connected to the network, just waiting to see if it stops, thankyou for helping
No problem.  If it doesn't we'll try checking the drivers and see if we can find you updated ones or not.
ahh, no luck, it done it again lol
dang ok click the Unity icon in the top right and search for "additional drivers"
i tried that and there was no additional drivers available. (a friend helpd with that lol)
not sure what else then.   Someone asked if you had a broadcom.   Is the laptop setup for dual boot so you still have windows?
no, just Ubuntu.
